lexUnit.name: lean.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be in or move into a sloping position.

sentence.text: She was solely feeling when he turned again and leaned above her .
There was general commotion as the tension ebbed , congratulations and condolences were exchanged , and one Member leaned around the door to give the highlights to the anxious press .
If I shift in my harness and lean nervously backwards I can see my partner creeping nearer on a wall of loosely compacted rubble , brushing and blowing the sand from the holds as he swings upwards .
Jessica leaned half out of the window , waving at him frantically to be silent , her face contorted .
` Edward came to Corfe from a hunt , and while his attendants were seeing to the dogs she allured him to her with female blandishment and made him lean forward . "
The three brothers leaned forward to look .
He leaned forward conspiratorially .
Rachel leaned forward eagerly .
Mahmoud leaned forward in his chair .
Penry leaned forward to take the mug from her .
He leaned across the counter .
She leaned across the desk .
He leant across the back seat so that he could look up and see her face .
Benjamin leaned across the table , ticking the points off on his long fingers .
I was leaning into the car to get the toddler out of the baby seat when I heard the shot .
She was running out of time and courage as it was , she admitted as she leaned into the wardrobe , searching for a pair of navy espadrilles .
As one of the two cops comes to lean into my window , the white van overtakes and glides on by .
When he started to his feet he had to lean hard on the arm of the chair while a moment of dizziness passed .
I leaned on the window .
I imagine she leaned eagerly over the desk towards me , as towards a pupil who has made a good point in his essay , smiling and nodding encouragingly .
He leaned over Emily 's shoulder to see what she was reading and turned back to his own copy of the paper .
Miss Pugh leaned over him .
So , when I gently lean over them , I recognise myself in
Vass leaned towards her , elbows propped on the desk .
It 's a sorry day ; " then leaning towards her , she said very quietly now , ` I 'm not blaming you , my dear .
Chen leaned towards Karr , keeping his voice low .
He leaned towards Urquhart .
She leaned away from him as far as she could go .
She leaned closer to him and lay her head against his shoulder .
Now lightly place your right hand behind your head and lean to your left side .
The driver leaned out of the window and shouted at the lad , sounded his horn twice , then drove on .
And as Roberts leaned in a window , police grabbed him and bundled him in .
Indeed , only three or four minutes into her talk , Shirley Brown had leaned across and whispered into Howard 's ear : ` Better than Ottawa ! "
Cally rapped on the Suzuki 's passenger window and he thought twice about leaning across and unlocking the door .
Fearnley was by now talking so quietly that I had to lean close to hear him .
She leaned back against the seat , her hands pressed between her own legs .
Neil Fraser leaned back in his chair .
Alexander leaned back against the cushions .
Laura yawned as she leaned back against the cushions .
Peter leaned down and slid his hand across his son 's forehead .
Bill might lean down and poke the crumbling framework .
But she leaned down and placed her soft lips gently on his bruised mouth .
Rory leaned down , reaching through the window of the pea-green car .
Cowley climbed into the back of the car , then leaned out the window to add , ` It seems that young Mayli has already located Colonel Lin Foh 's new hotel .
A man in the cab leaned out and shouted something at her as the fire engine churned past , but she could n't hear what .
Mrs Rogers leaned out .
Jack leant over his stepfather so that he could see him properly .
He leaned over the rail to peer down onto the lower deck .
She wanted to lean over and touch him , and , fearful though she was of men , and she shrank at the thought , she wanted him to touch her -- gently , of course .
She leaned over the sarcophagus and peered through the viewing glass .
Without a sign , without a word , Todger leaned down over him .
She leaned down for his kiss .
I 'm not supposed to tell you , 'cos your father said as how we 'd all got to put it out of our heads , but … ” she leaned down towards him , like a conspirator .
` You would like to be taken back to the town , monsieur ? " inquired Natalia , leaning down from the carriage .
Grimma leaned down to the perspiring drivers .
Tabitha leaned out over the railing .
He leaned out into the upstairs hall , heard voices at the front door .
Wrenching up the sash , he leaned out for a clearer view .
Still hurrying along at a hundred miles an hour he leaned over towards me and lowered his voice .
He leaned over to me .
The door opened again and the Customs officer leaned in , nodded once at Nathan , and withdrew .
Springer wound down his window , Sam leant in and shot him dead .
He leaned across and tapped Sir John on the arm .
He leaned inside and kissed her .
Easing herself gently to her feet she leaned slowly backwards .
Fig 61 As you rise up lean well forwards ; this will transfer much of your weight through the front arm on to the mast foot .
Cranston leaned sideways to catch a glimpse of the young clerk 's face .
He leaned to kiss her face , his eyes dark and serious .
Blood matted the blond hair , and Lindsey took a deep breath as she leaned closer to peer at the wound .
